11211.content:
It all started with a dream.

With all the hectic things going on Shirou expected it to be another dream about the fire that haunted him. He never expected to have a dream about girls of all things, such a typical teenager thing was just...well it wasn't odd it just seemed to come at a bad time. The Holy Grail War was underway, it was all Shirou could do to survive against the relentless other Masters and their Servants. It was not a time to do anything at leisure, so it was odd that his mind seemed to linger on the opposite sex.

Prior to the Holy Grail War there were a couple notable females in his life, Sakura and Taiga. They'd become something of his family over the years. Sakura was an increasingly attractive younger student and Taiga, a teacher, evolved into something of an elderly sister role. Then the War started and suddenly Shirou found himself surrounded by all these special girls. Rin Tohsaka, the perfect idol at his school now stayed with him and fought alongside him. Ilyasviel Von Einsbern, master magus and one of the most likely to win the war. The servant Rider, quiet and intimidating yet her beauty was still mesmerizing. Caster, whose face remained unknown to Shirou but radiated power and weakness at the same time. And then there was the most important one, the one who Shirou could never get off of his mind: Saber.

Saber was...different from anything he'd ever met. She was strong yet frail. Stern but kind. Human but at the same time otherworldly. She was a one of kind woman. How he got such a Servant he didn't know. But to him she was a person first and then a Servant, not vice-versa.

Perhaps it was that thought process that explained the dream. All these people, attractive in their own ways, be they enemies or friends just looked like people right now. Shirou stood before them all. Relationships, past events, none of that mattered. All that seemed relevant was the fact he was a man, and they were women. Maybe his frustrated teenage libido was just affecting his dreams, but the reason didn't change their presence.

Carefully Shirou took a step forward to Saber, her stern eyes were uncharacteristically shy. "Shirou..." Her voice sounded frail, like she would crack at any second and do something.

"You're going to pick her over me?!" A voice shouted from the side, Shirou stared dumbfoundedly at Tohsaka. "Idiot! Don't you know quality?"

"That's precisely why he won't pick you." A young voice mockingly stated. Shirou's gaze turned to Ilya. "Shirou wants to be with me!"

"If that were true..." A monotone voice broke in, now on the opposite side was Rider. "Why am I even here?"

"The same could be said for me." Caster chirped in.

"I already live with him!" A shy voice exclaimed, behind Shirou Sakura was blushing profusely. Beside her was Taiga who was strangely silent.

"Shirou."

"Huh?" The young man looked back to Saber. She looked confused.

"You...pick me right?"

"Who's it going to be Shirou?"

"Yeah! Go ahead and tell em!"

The voices began to conglomerate. The women surrounding Shirou seem to inch closer and closer until he finally just screamed."

"Aah!!'

A small shout left his lips, he was alone again, in his room. "Just a dream..." Relief flooded into him. The memories of his nightmare quickly began to vanish. "I wonder what that was all about?" Shirou's hand reached up to scratch his scalp but something felt off. His room was really dark for some reason it seemed a lot more spacious. Everything looked different too. It still felt like his room but...it was off. As he kept looking around Shirou noticed an opening on his ceiling, outside it looked bright as day. "Couldn't be..." Shirou had a sneaking feeling in his gut. He approached the wall and gripped it, it was soft like a cushion. Eyes narrowed the young man climbed up to follow his instincts.

"There's just no way..."

He neared the top and suddenly the area looked a lot more familiar. His room looked exactly as he left it, with one major difference.

"I shrunk?!"

Sure enough, the room was now a massive plain that would take hours to cross. Shirou couldn't have been more than a couple inches tall. Beneath him were his blankets he just crawled from. "What di- Whe-How?!" After failing to form several questions he finally settled on that one word. The alarm to his house didn't go off. No one was around him. So why was he shrunken?!

The questions quickly lost their significance. Loud footsteps came from the outside. Shirou noticed his room door sliding open. A female figure stepped in...
11211.title: Little Shirou

112111.content:
Large and intimidating as she looked, Shirou couldn't help but calm down once Saber walked in. There was no way Saber wouldn't notice him! Towering over his small frame, Saber took two steps into his room and looked around. A hand lazily grabbed at her hip as she started a double take, "Shirou?" Her stocking clad foot impatiently tapped on the ground whilst her eyes scanned the room yet a third time.

"Saber! Saber down here!" Atop his bed sheets Shirou jumped up and down with his arms flailing. Surely Saber would...Yes! She saw him! Almost immediately Saber's stern eyes locked onto him and...she did not look happy. "What's wrong Saber?"

"I would like to ask you the same thing." The Servant replied dully, clear distaste in her voice. "What is the meaning of this?" She took a step forward, now directly before Shirou and totally towering over him. "Is there something you want to tell me?"

" Huh?! I don't know what happened! I just woke up. Now I'm tiny and...and..."

The giant Servant looked appalled, "Don't tell me...Shirou...do you know what you've done?"

"What did I do?"

"Look at your Command Seal."

"Um...Okay." Even a casual glance told Shirou what was wrong, "Why is one missing?!"

"You used it."

"What?! When?! I don't remember doing that!"

Saber paused, "It occurred minutes ago. I was eating breakfast when I felt you use a Command Seal." The girl's face quickly gave her Master a sour look, "So pray, explain why I come in here to find you so tiny?"

"How am I supposed to know?! I wasn't even awake a couple minutes ago."

Saber's eyes widened, "...Oh...Maybe that explains the strange command you gave..."

Shirou's eyes widened, "Saber...What did I order you to do...?"

"It's nothing, you must have been dreaming."

"Saber." Even tiny Shirou felt her voice grow more demanding.

"You..." The Servant's face changed abruptly. The stern, sour look she'd been giving Shirou since finding him quickly vanished as she recalled something she tried to forget. Her face turned a tinge of red when she finally said it. "You commanded me...to make you mine."

"Huh? Yours...you mean like...." Now it was Shirou's turn to start blushing.

"I don't know." Saber took a breath. "The command was very vague. As a result I know not what effect it has had on me...Although it looks like you were affected more than I am."

"Just what I needed." Shirou sighed, "Tiny and one Command Seal short. How am I supposed to win the Holy Grail War like this?"

Then Shirou heard something he never expected in a million years.

"Why is winning the Holy Grail so important?"

As soon as the words left Saber's mouth she gasped, "I'm sorry...I don't know where that came from. I just...For a moment...the Grail didn't seem important."

"Given how weird this morning is I can't blame you." The young Master smiled.

"Yes...that's what it is..." Saber mumbled. "Honestly Shirou..." She sighed, "You were already a Master at a disadvantage before but now...Truly you lack discipline."

"You can lecture me all you want when I get back to normal."

"Yeah...Normal..."

"Can you take me to Tohsaka? She'll know what to do it."

There was an odd pause before Saber responded.

1121111.content:
Saber thought for a moment, before saying “That might be a good idea. It’d be good to check how your size will affect how much mana you can provide me as well, Shirou. Rin would probably know about all of that.” And with that, Saber smiled down at Shirou and picked him up, before gently placing him in her front shirt pocket. She announced to Shirou, “I’ll make sure to walk carefully, so you don’t get knocked around in there. But we’ll make it to Rin’s place soon!”


So Saber made her way to Rin Tohsaka’s house, keeping an eye down by her pocket to make sure that Shirou wasn’t too jostled around down there, and after a short walk, she makes it to Rin’s estate. Saber presses the door bell, and she can hear Rin shout, presumably to herself “Oh now what??” She opens the door and yells “Who?? … oh, Saber! What brings you here today?” Saber saw Rin’s face quickly shift from anger and frustration to relief, so she says “Hello, Rin. Are you well?”


Rin frowns and sighs, before saying “Things have been awful, Saber! Come on in, and I’ll explain over some snacks.” Saber’s eyes light up in anticipation as Rin leads her inside, and then Rin sets her down on her living room couch while she grabbed some cookies. Once Rin gets back, she plops down next to Saber and removes her school shoes, and Saber does the same with her boots, wanting to feel a bit more comfortable too. Rin hands Saber a cookie, and starts to explain her situation, saying “It all stated this morning!”


Shirou, who was also curious, made sure to listen as well, so he’d be in the loop once Saber showed him to Rin. Rin said “I woke up and made myself some breakfast, and then I went into the study to make up some plans based on what I know about the other masters and servants. And then I call Archer over, to get his input, but he doesn’t appear!” Saber gasped, and said “What? What happened to Archer?” Rin continued, saying “At first I just thought that he was being annoying, and ignoring me, but then I eventually saw a tiny doll that looked just like him on the table, expect it was waving at me. Archer shrunk somehow, and now I’m effectively stuck without a servant now, in the middle of the Holy Grail War!”


Saber frowned, and said “That’s awful Rin! So where is Archer?” And Rin just sighs and says “He’s not very happy about his new size either, so he’s probably off sulking somewhere.” Saber nods, but then her eyes light up again, and she says, “Oh yes, that reminds me; I need to show you something, Rin.” Saber then reaches into her pocket, and pulls Shirou out and places him on her palm, before presenting him in front of Rin.


Rin leans in close to the tiny Shirou, and the features of her face were magnified many times over for him. Her piercing aqua colored eyes seemed like they could gaze right into his diminished soul, and things only got more intense as she continued to slowly edge her face closer to him. Her long black hair, which was currently down, seemed like it could surround him like a vast forest. And she only stopped once her chin was nearly touching Saber’s hand, which meant that Shirou could reach her massive red lips if he only stretched his arms a bit, and he didn’t enjoy how close she was to him, or how Saber didn’t tell her yet about his condition.


Her lips slowly shifted into a grin, before Rin excitedly yelled “Is that a Shirou doll?? Did you make this Saber? You knew just how to cheer me up!” Saber silently gasped while Rin roughly snatched Shirou from her palm, gripping him tightly. Then she opened her palm, and started to poke and prod at Shirou with her right index finger, preventing him from making a sound. Then she said, while diligently playing with her Shirou ‘doll’, “It seems so life-like. It feels like I’m actually poking a tiny Shirou!” She began to laugh while Saber uncomfortably waited for a good moment to interrupted her.


She kept on poking at Shirou while laughing, but then she slowed down and said “Wait, Saber? Why is it moving about?” Then she stopped messing with him, as she figured that something was wrong, and she allowed Saber to explain. She said “Actually Rin, that’s actually Shirou. I found him like this in the morning, and we hoped that you could help.” Rin looked back down at Shirou, who laughed while still feeling dazed, and her face slowly but surely reddened in embarrassment. She tossed him away towards Saber, while yelling “You idiot Shirou! Why didn’t you tell me sooner??”


After things calmed down a bit, and Saber and Shirou explained the whole story to Rin, she thought to herself as she processed everything. Eventually, Rin says “Well, I have a few ideas, but I’m not in the best condition to help out someone right now, especially with my servant effectively out of commission.” She sighs while Shirou says, in a pleading tone “Please, Rin! I really need your help right now. I’d do anything in return!” And Rin quickly makes a sly grin, and says “Oh really, little Shirou? You’d accept my help, under any condition?”


Shirou bluntly replied, “Yeah sure, just nothing weird I guess.” Rin was silent for a second, before she glared down at the tiny boy, yelling “What’s that supposed to mean, you little jerk??” Shirou jumped back a bit, and said “I’m sorry, Rin! I wasn’t trying to be rude.” And while Rin continued to glare down at him, Saber added “Shirou, you shouldn’t be disrespectful towards Rin right now.” But Rin quickly regained her composure, and she said “I do have a good idea on what you could offer me Shirou. And if you accept my terms, then I’ll do whatever I can to fix your problem, and take care of you until you’re back to normal.”


Shirou nods and says “That’s fine, Rin.” So Rin explains, saying “As I’m sure you’re aware now, I’m down a servant. I cannot worry about you while I need to focus on my own survival, but I think we can help each other. You transfer Saber over to my command, and I’ll help you.” Shirou gasped, and said “But wouldn’t that be bad for me as well??” Rin just chuckled, and said “Perhaps, but it’s also true that you won’t be able to provide enough mana to Saber while you’re reduced in size. She probably won’t be able to maintain her physical form while she remains under your leadership. And even though it’d normally be pretty challenging for any master to have more than one servant at a time, Archer doesn’t require nearly as much mana while he’s tiny. So I’ll give Saber back to you once I fix Archer. Is it a deal?”


Shirou thinks for a moment, but quickly says “It’s fine with me. Saber, are you alright with this? I don’t want to make this decision for you.” Saber smiles and says “But Shirou, you’re my master. It doesn’t matter what I think of it.” But Shirou yells, “Of course it does Saber! You have feelings too, and you’re my friend!” Saber’s eyes well-up slightly after that comment, and after she composes herself, she says “Okay. I’m fine with it as well, Rin.”


So Rin grins and says “Perfect!” Then Rin makes the preparations to transfer Saber to become her servant, instead of Shirou’s. And once it was finished, Rin asked “All done! How do you both feel?” Shirou stretches and says “I feel like I have a lot more energy. I didn’t realize how tiring supporting a normal sized servant could be at my state.” Saber nods and says “I feel a bit better as well. Thank you, Rin.”


Then Rin says “Good! Saber, why don’t you take a nap for now? You must be exhausted, after running on such a small supply of mana.” But Saber replies, saying “No, I’m alright Rin. You don’t need to worry…” But Saber loudly yawned in the middle of her sentence, and a small tear formed in her right eye, so she said “Maybe you’re right, Rin.” So Rin smiles and says “I know! Head into the room on the left; there’s an empty bed you can rest in. I’ll keep an eye on Shirou.”
Saber says goodbye to Rin and Shirou, and then she takes her leather boots and goes into the bedroom, before closing the door behind her. Then Rin looks down at Shirou, who was still in her palm, and smirks before saying “Well then Shirou, wanna head to the kitchen for some lunch?” After a few moments of thought, Shirou eventually replies, saying:

1121112.content:
Saber paused for a moment, before saying “Shirou, maybe we should slow down and figure this out ourselves, before bothering Rin? She’ll be very busy worrying about the Holy Grail War, and I don’t think we should stress her anymore.”


Shirou first looked worried, but then he thought it through, and finally said “You’re right Saber. I’d feel terrible if I bothered Rin with this problem. Maybe we can solve this together.” Saber smiles at her master, before picking him up and walking to the dining room, and then sets him down on the table so they can discuss this together.


Saber starts, asking “So, is there anything you could think of that would get you to make this kind of command, even if it was in your sleep?” Shirou scratches his head, and starts to say “I’m not sure. I guess I wanted to feel like I’m not a burden to you, since I’m inexperienced as a mage. Or maybe I wanted to make things easier for you.” And Saber adds, “Like how you always cook for me, or when you give me foot massages after we have tough battles?” Shirou nods, and says “Yeah, so I guess subconsciously I’m not as concerned about the Holy Grail War than I thought.” Shirou laughs to himself, but then something sinks in for Saber, and her eyes grow wide.


She suddenly yells, “Wait a second! If you’re tiny, then how will we eat??” Shirou has a moment of blankness while he processes what Saber said, but then he starts to laugh again, which upsets Saber even more. She leans in to Shirou, until her mouth was almost touching the tiny master, and then she screams “Shirou!! Eating properly is a vital part of life, and I won’t let you trivialize this issue!” Saber’s hot and steamy breath rushed past Shirou, like a huge typhoon, and he was flung back while droplets of spittle covered him. She continued to pant heavily, keeping Shirou surrounded by her warm breath, while he looked in shock at her incredibly impassioned and widened blue eyes.


Then Saber blushes, covers her mouth, and bows her head while saying “Oh, I’m sorry Shirou! I shouldn’t have yelled like that.” Shirou just brushes himself off while getting up, and says “Don’t worry about it, Saber. And we’ll be fine for food. We still have my card, and I can always teach you how to cook too, so we won’t need to order food all the time.” Saber’s eyes shined like stars when he said that, and she could only mumble “Awesome…”


But then Shirou asks, “Saber? How are you able to remain materialized like this? Aren’t I providing less magical energy for you while I’m at this size?” Saber replies, saying “Oh! I actually feel like I have a lot more energy than usual. It might be another effect of the command you gave.” Then, Shirou instructs Saber how to make their breakfast, and once they started eating, they chatted some more.


Saber started to say, in-between mouthfuls of food, “I never realized how much fun making food was! It’s almost as great as eating it!!” And Shirou says, while eating his much smaller portion, “I’m glad you like to cook too! I’ll teach you whatever you like, Saber!” Saber grins, but then she says suddenly, “I just thought of this, but I really appreciate how you always gave me those massages, Shirou.” Shirou blushes, and says “Oh… don’t worry about it Saber. It’s the least I can do for you; after all you do to support me.”


After they both finish eating, Saber picks Shirou up and brings him to the living room with her, and she sets him on her lap after she sits down. Then Saber says “Today is our food shopping day, right Shirou?” And Shirou replies, saying “You’re right! I have a list on the table, so you can follow it when you go out Saber.” Saber nods, and says “Okay! But I should take you with me. I don’t want anything to happen to you while I’m gone, Shirou.”


Shirou agrees, and says “Yeah, I probably shouldn’t be alone right now. I’m even more vulnerable than I usually am.” Saber touches her chin with her index finger, while thinking of how to transport Shirou, and she eventually says “I’ve got an idea!” Shirou perks up, and asks “What’d you think of, Saber?” Saber grins, and says “I’ll place you in one of my boots, Shirou!” He slowly processes that suggestion, and he eventually says “Oh… wait, what?? Why your boot??” But Saber’s face gradually fell into a frown, and then she glared down at Shirou, and suddenly got up, causing him to fall onto the floor.


Before Shirou could react, she firmly planted her right stocking-clad foot on top of him, so her toes covered his body. She wasn’t crushing him, but she wasn’t letting him move either, and he was even able to squeeze his head between her big and 2nd toes. Saber had strong smelling feet for sure, since she was so active, but they weren’t unpleasant to Shirou. Once he was able to push his face past the sticky and thick stocking material, Shirou yelled “Saber??” But Saber put her hands on her hips, and said “What’s wrong with going in my boot, Shirou? You must like my feet; why else would you constantly give me foot massages whenever we finished a tough day? You should be more grateful!”


Shirou was dumbfounded. Saber never acted or treated him in this manner, and he wouldn’t have thought that him being smaller would change that. But he wondered if that dream command had more of an effect on her than she realized, which made Shirou want to be as agreeable with Saber as he could; at least until this craziness ended. Before he could give an answer, Saber’s eyes welled up with tears, and she released her foothold on him, and gently picked him up.


Saber placed Shirou in her palm, knelt down, and started to say “I’m so sorry Shirou! I don’t know what came over me!!” Her face was very close to Shirou’s tiny body, but he just warmly smiled at her. He closer to her face, and patted the tip of her nose gently, showing her that he wasn’t upset by that outburst. Shirou says “It’s okay Saber. That command must have a strong effect on the both of us. And if going in your boot would be the easiest way to carry me around, without any other mages or servants finding me; then I’ll gladly accept it.”


Saber smiled again, and said “Thanks Shirou! And if you’d rather just go in my pocket, then just let me know. I’ll protect you either way.” Shirou nodded, and added “Also Saber, I think the command seal made me more durable as well, so you won’t need to worry about accidentally hurting me while I’m small!” After hearing that, Saber grins and says “Great!”


Then Shirou took a deep breath, and said “Okay, Saber!”

"Um...are you sure this is a good idea Natalia?" The wide eyes of a child stared up at a beautiful woman in a revealing white top and jeans. "Whether or not you back out is not my concern though."

Emiya Kiritsugu sat in the middle of an intricate magic circle inside of Natalia's workshop. It resembled the kind of place one would expect a mercenary to live which made sense. At a single motion from the woman he called his mentor the circle would activate. He was apprehensive knowing what was about to come, but if it was a part of his training then he had no choice. He'd already lost everything, all he had left was his dream and in order to achieve that he needed Natalia's training. He had to bite his lip but his eyes looked back to the woman with determination and a nod.

Natalia nodded in return, "I'll remind you. Once I do this it isn't over until I say so. Should you fail to reach my standards or die along the way I'll never undo the spell. Even knowing that you wish to proceed?"

"Get on with it." Kiritsugu impatiently retorted.

"Very well..." Wordlessly Natalia knelt down and laid her hand on the edge of the circle. Her lips opened to say something but it was too fast and in a language too foreign to make sense. Kiritsugu's eyes never left her the entire time. The chant was long, taking a full ten seconds before the circle basked the room in a white glow. Defiantly the boy stared into the blinding light, not letting his eyes shut. He could feel the spell working on his body, everything around him was changing. As determined as he was moments ago, even he couldn't hold back the small gulp that came when the light died down.

The already towering Natalia was now just inhumanely gigantic. Kiritsugu saw himself eye level with the tip of her boots. Craning his head back as far as he could he could only make out the fluttering edge of her shirt. She was too big and too close for him to even see anything else, if he wanted to actually look all the way up to his teacher's face he'd have to back up quite a bit. Not that it mattered anyway, beyond her knees Natalia's immense figure began to blur. She truly did shrink Kiritsugu down to the size of a bug like she told him.

With little change in her expression Natalia knelt her head over to see the speck before her feet. "Now, you are facing a magus whom you have no hope to survive against. Survive."

Before Kiritsugu had time to fully realize the situation he was now in the ground around him darkened in shadow. What was the sky was now replaced with the leather sole of his teacher's boot. There was no need to think about what she was doing, Kiritsugu took off running as soon as the ground around him changed. Natalia was merciless, she stomped as quickly as a normal person would a bug. There was no slowing down for the sake of her student. It was only by inches that her foot missed Kiritsugu, but already it was back up and tracing the air over him.

BOOM!

Another stomp came dangerously close, it was a quick, instinctive roll that saved Kiritsugu from death. But like before his teacher had her foot already in the air for the next one. "You have to do better than that bug boy! I've only stomped twice and can go on for hours. Use your physical ability and wit to evade and if that isn't sufficient resort to magic. This is life or death. Your enemy will show you no quarrel!" Natalia's foot began to lower again, this time more gradual but her foot was following her prey this time. Kiritsugu had no hope of escaping like he had been. There was only one option.

The child closed his eyes and thought the key phrase. His magical circuits stirred to life to activate his spell.

Time Alter...Double Accel

The world seemed to slow down to Emiya Kiritsugu. Only he retained normal movement. He ran as fast as his child legs could. Right over his head Natalia's boot was close enough he could touch it. In the corner of his eye Kiritsugu noticed the splattered remains of a bug. That would soon be him if he didn't hurry. His chest started to hurt but he kept running. He had his spell on for several seconds and its toll was already becoming apparent. But the end was right in sight. With a final dive the young man safely landed outside of the danger zone. His spell gave way right then and time reverted to normal. A puff of dust hit the child in the face from Natalia's stomp, but he avoided it.

However there was no time to relax. His Master already had her foot back in the air and Kiritsugu continued running. He only had enough in him for one more Double Accel. And even if he cast it it had no chance of lasting as long as his first one. But it had to do, before Natalia got any closer the boy focused his magic and gave one final burst. His body felt as if it was going to explode, everything got hazy, but the boom came from behind Kiritsugu. His head turned back to see another narrowly avoided stomp, a fatal mistake. Natalia quickly bent over and plucked the child from the ground with ease. He was now dangled before her harsh eyes helplessly.

"Now you're in the enemies clutches and you're out of magic. In other words, you're dead."

Kiritsugu winced, expecting his teacher's fingers to tighten until he popped, but instead her eyes eased slightly. "But that's to be expected on your first day. You did satisfactory for now."

"I bet you want a reward?" Natalia's tone changed and her eyes had a strange look to them. Kiritsugu didn't understand but he caught sight of her free hand gently tugging at her chest. The kid blushed when he saw quite literally two mountains right beneath him. He was brought closer to Natalia's face, her breath began to gently blow against his body. "I'm sure at this size I must look like some kind of deity. Even to you my body must look inviting. But not happening." Kiritsugu was pulled away and gently placed upon a table where a number of guns laid.

Natalia began to pace the room, "I'm sure you feel proud to survive your first session but I'd like to point out some things. It probably looked to you like you were covering a lot of ground but you only covered about two feet. I didn't even have to change my position. And you ran out of Prana by the fifth stomp. Enemies won't have the mercy I have. If I just gave one more stomp you'd have been crushed."

Kiritsugu gulped.

"You still have a lot to learn." Natalia pulled a chair and sat down near the table. "Magi are going to outclass you, and weapons aren't enough. You need to learn how to survive and outlast them. But we'll get there." There were a couple loud thumps that said she removed her boots. "All things considered you're doing well for a kid. But training's done for the day, no point in doing something when you have no prana. So in the mean time make yourself useful."

"Huh?" Kiritsugu jumped, "What do you mean?"

Natalia shrugged, but there was a clear mischief in her eyes "There's a few hours left in the day so I think you should..."

It didn't matter at this point, Kiritsugu had long since not cared what he was doing. His hands quickly went to work removing any small grime he found between each toe. With where he was he expected the smell to be stronger than ever, but it seemed that he was massaging for so long the smell had the chance to vanish. Probably lucky for him.

His whole body felt like it was covered in oil, he felt dirty. The towering left foot that remained seemed like an incredibly daunting task now, but he went to work again.

As his hands began to work on the base of Natalia's foot he noted there was no sweat now. It must've dried up at some point. Although his hands still got coated in the oils. He just went back into his almost robotic process.

Since it was right in front of him he began to notice aspects of Natalia's feet. In the short time he'd known her he knew right away the woman was incredibly attractive, a trait that seemed to echo to her feet too. Even worn out her soles were smooth, silky even, and had no blemishes or odd spots. The smell in itself wasn't so much bad as it was...different than what Kiritsugu usually smelled. Looking back he was hesitant to even describe it as bad. The sweat and oils were natural for all people, but something about Natalia's seemed to almost decorate her feet in a complimentary way. Each of the toes Kiritsugu noted were essentially perfect. They were each well-defined, soft, the perfect length, even the pinky toe which usually looks like an ugly addition on people stood perfectly as if it belonged. Not to mention each toe was painted with a silvery-blue to match Natalia's hair. Her feet were just...perfect.

With that realization Kiritsugu thought about the whole body of his friend. Perhaps it was his young mind going lustfully but he was having trouble finding any way to describe Natalia aside from perfect. A big chest that was well defined proportional. A nice-sized rear that fit tightly against her pants. A beautiful face. Even her usual cold demeanor was in itself an oddly appealing thing, it gave the idea she was always in charge of what was happening.

131321.content:
It was that nightmare again. Ever since the Holy Grail War began it came, clearer and clearer each time. Death. There would just be death all around her. Her eyes would casually glance around the city as she stumbled about, and any soul who was near her was quickly devoured in a wave of darkness. It was no different from eating a meal, only the hunger never seemed to cease. People were fed to this darkness without accord but it never seemed to satisfy her. Sakura Matou clenched the sheets of her bed as the horrible dream progressed. She finally had her Senpai, Shirou to herself. She was actually spending time with her sister. As bad as the situation was with the crest worm within her, her dreams were actually coming true. So why, why were these terrible dreams haunting her?!

Her mind cried out that question but the dream progressed without any indication from her. She took a step forward then that was it, there was blood everywhere. But it wasn’t the blood of someone else. Sakura’s eyes trailed down as a numbing sensation filled her body. Jutting out of her torso was a sword. Here is where the dream would end, where she was about to die. But it wasn’t ending; the pain she was feeling was very real. It was a pain that should wake someone up, but the dream wasn’t ending. Sakura felt her dream body collapse on the ground in a pool of blood. Tears began to fill her eyes. They said that if you die in a dream you die in real life. The thought lingered in her mind with a saddened memory of her Senpai.

“Oh? You’re still alive? Impressive.”

“Huh?” Sakura thoughtlessly raised her eyes. Standing before her was a man clad entirely in gold with a smug grin. Something about him seemed familiar.

“Do not worry girl. I will put an end to your misery before it taints this land any further.” The man continued, “How pitiful though. All the suffering you’ve gone through and the world just turns you into a monster. Do not worry though. I shall save you little monster.” As his sentence closed a void of light appeared behind the man, coming out of it were dozens of swords and weapons. Sakura didn’t have to think about it, dream or not those blades were going to kill her.

Maybe it’s for the best. If I die Senpai will…Sakura closed her eyes only to see a mental image of Shirou. The thought of not being with him, the thought of no longer seeing his face, it filled the girl with an indescribable emotion. This feeling overpowered the pain in her body. Soon the girl found herself staring defiantly at the gold man, “No!!”

“What?!” The man was caught off guard and that was it. His eyes looked in horror at a tentacle of pure darkness that had already grasped his leg. It started to devour him. The man attempted to summon his blades to pierce Sakura but in less than a minute it was done. Normally it would be instantaneous but the man was strong enough to last almost a full sixty seconds. In the end it was irrelevant though. He was but another meal. The man was devoured and Sakura felt the blade in her body vanish. The wound began to close of its own accord but the powering emotion remained. Sakura began to rise to her feet in the pool of her own blood. She began to recognize the feeling. It was her own selfish desires. The world, her sister, Shirou, they’d all be better off without her. But she simply couldn’t let herself pass away. Her life was too sad, she wanted a happy ending where she would be with Shirou. And nothing was going to stop her.

Sakura looked down into the pool to a reflection of her smile.

-----

“S-Sakura!!?!”

Sakura weakly opened her eyes to the sound of her Senpai’s shout, “What is it Sen-“ Right when her eyes opened everything changed. “-PAI?!!”

The room was completely trashed…No, it’d be more accurate to call it crushed. The bed was broken right down the middle and laid on the floor. The desk was a bunch of pieces of wood. But none of that mattered. Because from Sakura’s perspective the room was just puny! Her Senpai was at the doorway but her leg was partially through the doorway. The bed she went to just last night looked barely bigger than a baby’s bed. It was painfully obvious what happened but Sakura couldn’t quite grasp the words. “I-I’m-“

“Giant!” Shirou finished with an exclamation.

Whatever the reason may have been, Sakura was now a giant. The room couldn’t even fit her anymore; the walls were broken to make way for her expanding legs. It wasn’t a significant amount of damage but that did little to stop her dismay.

An alerted female voice called from a distance, “What’s wrong?” In seconds Tohsaka Rin burst into the scene only to join in the mouth agape awe. However she was the first to regain herself, “Sakura, do you think you can work your way into the courtyard?” Meekly the girl nodded.

“Good, do that. Let’s go Shirou.”

“Huh?!”

“Why does Senpai have to go?!” Sakura quickly objected.

“Because you’re naked.”

At that moment the obvious finally came to light and the giantess screamed louder than ever.

Minutes later, once Tohsaka lead Shirou away, Sakura carefully worked her way out into the open area of the Emiya courtyard. Her mind didn’t stop. Why did this happen? She asked herself. Was it not enough that she was having horrific nightmares each night? Was it not enough that her Senpai lost an arm because of her?! Why did the world only continue to punish her?! Tears began to well up in the giantess’ eyes. Any second now the tears would stream down. But even so she got out to the courtyard and seated herself as low as possible so no one would see. At the very least being huddled against the ground did a decent job of covering her sensual areas.

Senpai…Sakura fought back her tears to avoid further troubling her lover. The minutes seemed to continue to roll by with no change. Tohsaka and Shirou were still inside and for whatever reason they saw fit to leave Sakura out by herself. It’s probably nee-san knowing her...She realized. Shirou would never leave her side, so the fact he wasn’t out yet meant Tohsaka was stopping him for some reason. The idea of those two alone did stir well with the giantess. She knew Shirou fancied her. Who wouldn’t? She’s the perfect girl. She’s…not Sakura. The violet-haired girl lowered her eyes to the dirt. That’s what she was in comparison to her sister: Dirt. But even so Shirou chose her over her sister. She had him, and she didn’t want to even risk losing him. If only her sister wasn’t in the picture, Sakura’s eyes looked to her now giant hand. It wasn’t unthinkable to think such a hand could crush her sister.
It’d be no different that swatting a bug.

No! I won’t ever do that!! Sakura shook away all such thoughts.

Right at that moment Sakura heard a door open, her eyes looked up to see her sister and Senpai, who was blindfolded. For a brief moment the giantess was surprised at her size; for all intents and purposes she was lying as low to the ground as she could. But even with her head down to the ground it was still about waist high to a normal person.

“Nee-san? Why is Senpai blindfolded?”

Tohsaka looked at Shirou, “Because I don’t think we have anything we can use to cover you so I instead decided to cover lover boy.” Tohsaka’s eyes then grew serious. “Sakura…Do you mind if I do a few tests?” Sakura nodded and the magus went to work.

As it would happen the tests were little more than Tohsaka planting her palm on Sakura’s body at key points, measuring her body and magical energy, simple things like that. Sakura complied as best she could. Shirou seemed to have been informed already as he didn’t offer any arguments. After a few minutes of stumbling blind he seated himself beside what he thought was a wall but was in fact Sakura’s leg.

“Don’t worry Sakura! Whatever this is we’ll fix it for you!” He sounded confident.

“Thank you Senpai…” Sakura smiled, unable to say anything else. She spotted the cloth on her lover’s arm, the arm he got when he lost his old one. Guilt bit at her but she didn’t say anything. “Senpai…I’m sorry I’m such a burden.”

“Don’t be silly Sakura! You aren’t a burden. Remember who you’re talking to. I love to help people!” He grinned in the general direction he knew Sakura was at.

“Senpai…” Sakura could only continue to smile.

“Damn.” Tohsaka interrupted their conversation.

“Nee-san, what’s wrong?”

“…I have no idea.” The magus sighed. “I have no idea what the cause of this is Sakura. I measured your height up to about twenty-five feet and your magical energy has increased to match but other than that I have no idea. I can only assume this has something to do with the crest worm but if it does I don’t know how we can handle it. There’s only one person who does.”

“Zouken.” Shirou finished. Sakura averted her gaze at the name. Her grandfather…the man who made her suffer so much.

“Which is why I’m going to go pay him a visit.” Tohsaka stood up.

“Huh?!” Sakura and Shirou spoke in unison.

Tohsaka continued nonchalantly, “It’s not for you. You being this big now is a clear risk of revealing magi to the world. It’s my duty to confront Zouken about this.”

1313211.content:
“I-I’ll go with you!” Shirou stood up as well.

This time Sakura and Tohsaka gaped at him, “Huh?!”

Despite being blindfolded Shirou turned to his friends confidently, “We have no choice but to find him now. And when we do we can get him to get rid of that crest worm Sakura.”
Obviously it wouldn’t be that easy, but something about the way the young man said it almost made it seem like it would be.

“Are you stupid or something? Look at you! Your arm still hasn’t healed, and Sakura needs someone here with her an-“ Shirou didn’t even react. Tohsaka sighed, “I won’t talk you out of this will I?”

“That’s Senpai for you.” Sakura giggled, “Once he sets his mind to something there’s no stopping him.”

Shirou looked towards his giantess friend, “Sorry Sakura. I don’t want to leave you alone but we need to find Zouken as soon as possible.”

“It’s okay Senpai,” She nodded kindly, “Besides, I have Rider.

“That is true…” Tohsaka mumbled to herself, “Plus with your increased magical energy she’s probably even stronger now. I suppose you should be fine on your own.”

“At my size is anyone going to want to hurt me?” The gentle giantess joked.

“True…” Tohsaka walked over to Shirou and undid his blindfold. “Let’s go. We’ve already spent half the day here.”

The young man nodded but not before heading towards Sakura’s face. He gently knelt down beside her, “I promise you Sakura, we’ll save you.”

“Senpai…”

Shirou gave her a small goodbye kiss before standing back up. “We’ll be back soon!” Without waste he turned and ran out the door with Tohsaka.

Sakura watched them leave with a forced smile. Once they were out of sight her eyes grew notably sadder. All this trouble was because of her, and now because of her pesky size she couldn’t even do simple things like cook or clean anymore. She couldn’t even…be with Shirou anymore. Her face blushed as she remembered some of their…intimate nights. The few pleasures she had in this situation were growing fewer. At this point all she had was the time she spent with her Senpai, but he was going to be gone all day…with her sister. She shouldn’t have been jealous about that but she was. But it went beyond that. There was a part of Sakura…a part she never wanted to acknowledge, a part that just wished Tohsaka wasn’t in the picture at all. Then she wouldn’t have to worry. Shirou would be all hers.

The giantess shook her head again at the thought, but like before her eyes trailed to her hand. It really would be like crushing a bug…

----

Shirou and Tohsaka stopped at their destination: the Matou household. It loomed before them almost ominously, but it didn’t seem as if the building actually had any evil intent to it. It was more as if the ominous air was just the natural feeling of the building. Tohsaka bit her lip at the feeling, “I don’t sense any magical energies here. The Matou may have a weakened magus bloodline but it’s odd that there’s no defenses at all.”

“Is it empty?” Shirou queried. “He might know we’re looking for him and have hidden.”

“It’s possible.” The girl admitted, “But we don’t have any other leads.” Gently, she took a step forward, then another, no change seemed to occur. The steps slowly grew more frequent until both her and Shirou were inside. “I’ll check upstairs, can you check the bottom?”

“Yeah.” Shirou nodded. Tohsaka began to go to the upper floor as Shirou stayed and looked through the rooms of the ground floor. He found an exquisite dining hall, lavishly decorated and beautiful. But it seemed so…token, it looked almost like it was there for show. The only feeling in this entire building was the ominous, disquieting feeling that puts one on edge. It almost felt as if the house was just a façade for a different world entirely. Despite this clear feeling Shirou ventured further into the room. In the corner was a shadow that caught his eye. It almost seemed…alive. But the young man quickly realized the feeling of something alive wasn’t coming from the shadow…not the shadow was blocking a doorway. And something was in it.

“You came before I could invite you Emiya Shirou.” A haggard, old voice called from the doorway.

“Zouken!” Shirou clenched his teeth and, without thinking, ran into the darkness. Inside was a room lit a sickening green. It resembled a dungeon, with stone stairs leading down into a pit of darkness. Only it wasn’t darkness…it was something alive…Shirou felt the desire to retch as he realized: insects. The ground was littered with thousands upon thousands of insects, and in the middle of them stood the wrinked mass that was Matou Zouken.

The weak-looking old man looked to Shirou with soulless eyes, “I take it you are here about Sakura?”

“Take the crest worm out of her! It’s killing her, made her grow and…”

“Hmm?” Zouken raised an eyebrow, “Grow? I know nothing of such magic boy. Whatever it may be that caused that, it wasn’t my crest worm. Besides, even if it was; I couldn’t remove it if I wanted to.”

“What?!”

“Sakura has long-since outmatched me. She’s been feeding each night, last night she feasted on a servant and I could no longer control her. I cannot remove the crest worm because the moment she would see me she would kill me. And I cannot control her anymore to avoid that.”

Zouken’s words were straightforward but somehow cryptic, “Feast? Kill? What are you talking about Zouken?!”

The old man found Shirou amusing, his chuckles were echoing taunts in the chamber. “You know exactly what I mean boy.” Shirou grimaced. “The shadow that has been terrorizing the city at night and devouring people. Sakura's bizarre condition. We have long-since left the realm of magics I can handle. There is only one person who is capable of doing this.”

“Sakura.” Shirou finished. All the strength in his legs vanished.

“Indeed. Sakura is the Shadow. You can choose to leave her be and she will surely devour more and more each night. Or you can choose to continue down this road you have started. Either way I cannot do anything.” With his cryptic words echoing into the dark the bugs swarmed around Zouken and slowly, his body began to vanish into the swarm. In minutes there was no trace of his presence.

Shirou retched. He abandoned everything for Sakura, but now his choice is quite clearly Sakura, or the world. He rose to his feet, already aware of his choice. He exited the room and found Tohsaka looking for him.

“Shirou! Are you okay? You look pale.”

The young man nodded, “Yeah. That room just…gave me a bad vibe. But Zouken wasn’t in there.”

“Damn.” Tohsaka clicked her tongue, not aware of the deceit. “I guess we’ll just have to head back and try something else.”

“Yeah…” Shirou nodded.

The two headed home together. A lot more time seemed to have passed than either of them thought as it was already growing dark. By the time they finally arrived home Shirou began to prepare dinner. Sakura seemed to have fallen asleep from boredom at some point being unable to do much else besides lay around. After dinner everyone very quickly settled in.

That nightmare came again. Could it be called the same nightmare though? Something about this time was different. Like always Sakura felt her dream self dragging her feet along the cold pavements of the roads. There was still the strong presence of death everywhere. But something was different. Once she finally realized what it suddenly seemed so obvious. It was her size. In her nightmare she was a giant too. In her vision she could make out cars near her ankles, with each step the ground seemed to give way slightly to her immense figure. Even to her ears she could hear the booms that were her footsteps; how was anyone sleeping through this? The answer was simple: they weren't.

With each and every step Sakura's gigantic form stirred people awake, and people, curious as they were, would step outside to investigate what seemed like a series of tremors. Sakura looked to the people in their homes coming out.

Don't do it...She tried to warn them but no sound came out of her mouth. It would've done no good anyway. The darkness devoured everyone before they could exclaim about the giantess. Something about their tiny pleas was very pleasant to hear, Sakura felt her lips begin to smile. Her feet continued to drag themselves along the roads to get the attention of more people. Her mind cried out against what she was doing, but there was no denying it.

She was enjoying herself.

-----

"Uwah!" Sakura's eyes flew open, her mouth gasping for air. "Thank goodness, it was just a dream." She sighed. However when she re-opened her eyes...

"Aaah!!!"

"Sakura!!" A couple shouts came from nearby; their voices were familiar but they never sounded more distant than they did now. The giantess saw two familiar figures enter the open area of the Emiya household. Sakura wasn't in there though, she couldn't be. Because Sakura Matou was standing in front of the entire house at over a hundred feet high.

Tohsaka and Shirou stared dumbfoundedly at the giantess. The sun was just beginning to rise and they all hoped it was some sort of illusion from the night. It had to have been thirty minutes of all of them staring at each other, hoping that the increasingly blue sky would reveal it all to be a trick. Of course it wasn't. Once the sun had fully risen and the sky fully blue did Tohsaka finally break the long silence. "Oh my God..."

With the silence broken the air seemed to ease slightly. Sakura gently lowered herself onto the streets so her head hovered over the two tiny people. "Senpai, what happened?!"

"D-Don't worry Sakura! We can fix this, we can-" Shirou turned to Tohsaka for something, anything. The magus could only click her tongue and run into the building. "T-Tohsaka?!"

"Nii-san..." Sakura mumbled.

The next minute Tohsaka returned with a grim expression, "It's just as I feared..." Her voice was serious,, it was the tone she had whenever she put her feelings on hold to act. "I just checked the TV to see something."

"-And?!" Shirou impatiently asked.

"-Nothing. As in, no local news at all. Local stations have been completely stopped." She paused as if uncertain to continue, "...It looks like we can't keep playing nice Shirou."

"What?" Shirou and Sakura looked confused.

"I just sent out a familiar to check for life out in the city, there's nothing. Nothing except footprints." Tohsaka glared at Sakura, "Giant footprints."

"What are you saying?!" Shirou was as uncouth as always.

"I'm saying exactly what we've all known in our hearts. The Shadow gained enough power to completely devoid this town of life, and the fact it's now a giant can only lead to one conclusion- Sakura, you are the Shadow."

Each word Tohsaka said came off cold and calculating, but they weren't a surprise. In his mind Shirou recalled Zouken's words. You can choose to leave her be and she will surely devour more and more each night. Or you can choose to continue down this road you have started. He had only waited a single night, but was all of Fuyuki really gone as a result?

"What are you saying Nii-san? I didn't go anywhere, I was asleep! I-"

"Then why are your feet dirty?"

Sakura gasped. There was no way Tohsaka could actually see her feet past the wall of the house, but she couldn't bring herself to check to disprove her. Because she knew, she knew she was right. "They...They were just nightmares."

Tohsaka took a step forward, "I'm sorry Sakura, but as the head of the Tohsaka household and your sister it's my duty to kill you and save everyone from a madman like Zouken." The woman's arm began to glow, she was on the verge of casting magic. But Shirou and Sakura knew she wouldn't be able to do it. At her size Sakura wouldn't be wiped out so easily, especially if her magical energy has increased as Tohsaka said yesterday. But even so the magus was going to try, her hand was aimed at Sakura."

"Tohsaka!!" Shirou ran to try and stop her but it was too late. A series of chants came from Tohsaka's lips and out came a blast of energy. Sakura screamed as it hit her.

"I'm sorry..." Tohsaka muttered under her breath.

"Tohsaka what did you-?!"

The smoke began to clear around Sakura's face, revealing the bleeding wound on her neck. Almost in a trance, Sakura's hand touched her injured juggular and her eyes widened.

"I destroyed her juggular, soon she'll die before any more harm could be done." Tohsaka's words came out coldly.

"Tch." Shirou bit his lip, "Sakura!!"

The giantess looked to Shirou and smiled, "I love you Senpai, even now when all I've done is be a burden I-"

"It's okay Sakura, we'll get through this!!" Shirou sounded desperate, behind him the magus was silent.

"Senpai..." Sakura smiled, but her mind remembered her dream yesterday. How in that dream she almost died and her mind turned to the young man before her. How if she died she'd never see him again, how even if he would be better off she couldn't die without him. How she couldn't die without him. He was hers. No one was going to take him from her.

"What?!" The two before Sakura exclaimed, Sakura herself knew why. The wound on her neck was now healing. If her dreams were indeed reality such things couldn't kill her anyway. For what felt like the first time in her life, Sakura smiled at the people before her. "I'm not going anywhere Nii-san." Her voice changed in an instant, this wasn't the meek voice of the girl before. This was the confident voice of a woman who knew what she was capable of.

Sakura stood to her full height, easily towering over the neighborhood. Around her ankles stirred a darkness she recognized. With her smile, the darkness, and her height she must've looked like some sort of demon. But that didn't matter. She took a step forward, her foot easily crushing the wall that separated Shirou and Tohsaka from her. "You've always been like this."

"Sakura!" Tohsaka looked rightfully scared. Near her Shirou looked too stunned to react.

Sakura turned and continued to follow the wall instead of going forward. "Always acting cold."

BOOM!

"Always the perfect person."

BOOM!

"Always trying to hurt me."

BOOM!

"Always trying to take Senpai from me."

BOOM!

"But now look at you." Sakura stopped after destroying everything besides the main building. Her feet were before Tohsaka now. "You're just a bug to me. I'm greater than you could ever hope to become. I'm..." The giantess paused to search for an appropriate word, only one came to mind. "...I'm a Goddess." Finally came out. Sakura raised her sole, revealing the dirt and grime she got from the previous night. "It would be so easy to just crush you...But I won't." Her foot returned to the ground. "Because even if I hate you Nii-san, even if you make me miserable...I do love you." Sakura smiled down at the bug, "So I will keep you alive. You can become a part of me."

Tohsaka knew what she meant, around Sakura's feet the darkness that devoured people was dancing in anticipation.

"Consider it an honor. I'll let you experience everything I've felt over the years." Without waste Sakura let the shadows eat Tohsaka into the void. It lasted seconds.

"Sakura..." Shirou finally managed to speak, sounding completely broken now.

"I can feel her struggling Senpai." Sakura smiled, "She's begging for me to let her back out, but we both know that won't be happening." The giantess began to pace again, her feet walking around Shirou regardless of what was in their path. "But that begs the question of what to do with you Senpai. If I'm a Goddess then what are you? I still love you, but I'm definitely superior now. What should I do?"

Dim lights bathed the park in their harsh glow as Shiki walked down the darkened path. He had come here in the middle of the night to meet with Arcueid, but it seems he had arrived a bit early, as the white princess was nowhere to be found. She was always harping on him to show up on time for their little late-night rendezvous, so it was unusual that she wasn’t greeting him with her usual crooked smile. Shiki just hoped she wasn’t off causing trouble somewhere. After all, the whole purpose for this meet-up was so they can go hunt the vampire that has been ravishing the town.

Sighing, he decided to sit down on a nearby bench to wait. Before he can even take another step, however, he was flung forward as if he was hit from behind by a truck. Sent sprawling, he gulped in air frantically. Strangely, besides being out of breath, he didn’t feel any major injuries. But what could suddenly throw him through the air like that? A wave of fear washed through Shiki’s body as he imagined being torn apart by a vampire before he could even grab his knife. As it is, without Arcueid by his side, he felt helpless.

Fortunately, no follow-up attack yet ravaged his prone body, but as he drew himself to his feet, he felt a tremor shake him to his very core. It was followed by another, and another, threatening to knock Shiki on his rear. Looking around for the massive creature that must be making these earthquakes, he notices that everything seems… different. Larger. The streetlamps stretch upwards to infinity, and the bench that he almost sat on is now taller than the highest tree. Being the size of a bug will certainly make him easy prey for even the weakest vampire.

As he reaches for his knife, an impossibly tall figure strides into view, blocking out the flickering streetlights. This person was wearing long black robes and high-laced boots, which Shiki couldn’t help but think looked really cool. As he craned his neck upward, he saw that this person had short blue hair and blue eyes, just like Ciel-senpai at school, but lacking her trademark glasses. And, unlike his spunky upperclassman, this person had an icy countenance, looking more like a trained killer than a schoolgirl. She continued to walk towards Shiki until he was almost flattened under her boots, then abruptly stopped.

“These shrinking swords really work. I will have to thank the Church,” the robed woman said, glancing at the razor-sharp blades between the fingers of her right hand. The blades disappeared in a cloud of sparks as she turned her stony gaze on Shiki. “Do not be afraid, Tohno-kun. This is for your own good,” she said, as she bent down and extended her hand toward Shiki. Paralyzed by fear, Shiki stood stock-still as the woman’s fingers extended like talons, blocking out even the light of the full moon overhead. Enveloped by darkness, he squeezed his eyes shut as her hand closed around him tightly. Her skin was soft and warm, almost a pleasant feeling against the chilly night air. He squeezed his eyes as she stood up and lifted him to eye level. Shiki sat on his rear as he fingers uncurled, leaving him staring up into her expressionless blue eyes.

“Ciel-senpai, is that you? Why are you doing this?” Shiki asked, dumbfounded. “I cannot allow you to go gallivanting around with that princess, Tohno-kun. It is far too dangerous for a mere human like you,” she explained, her words as icy as her stare.

“But you’ve got it all wrong! Arc isn’t a bad person! And anyway, how did I end up like this?” Shiki protested. Without answering, the scary Ciel-like person turned her head towards the entrance to the park. “There’s no time to explain. It seems the princess has arrived,” she said, turning back towards Shiki. “We must leave immediately. Forgive me, Tohno-kun, but these garments have no pockets.”

Shiki wondered what she was apologizing for, until her hand slowly approached her opening mouth. He tried to scramble up her fingers to get away from her gaping maw, but she tipped her hand until he was sliding down her palm. Ciel’s tongue emerged to greet him, and Shiki tumbled face-first into the damp muscle. His fingers clawed for purchase on the wet tongue as Ciel drew it back into her mouth. The moonlit park disappeared as Shiki passed under her nose and into the steaming cavern. Gleaming white teeth surrounded him, even more frightening than any of the beasts that spawned from Chaos. The tongue writhed underneath him, denying him any chance of a steady foothold. He lay spread-eagle on the pink muscle, right before Ciel’s lips clamped shut, sealing Shiki inside a sopping-wet, hellishly hot prison. He held onto the tongue for dear life like a bucking bronco as Ciel began running along rooftops on her way back to her apartment. Meanwhile, the saliva level was rising dangerously high inside her mouth. Shiki was forced to swallow gallons of the stuff as he desperately tried to choke down some air in his dank hell. Even her saliva tasted like curry!

Shiki was on the verge of passing out when an influx of light and cool air washed over him. Sticking two fingers inside of her mouth, Ciel roughly plucked Shiki off her tongue and placed him on the nightstand next to her bed. Now utterly drenched in her stinking saliva, Shiki was simply glad his glasses were indestructible. As he wiped them off, he took a look around Ciel’s apartment. The small dwelling was sparsely furnished, but it looked comfortable enough.

“I shrank you because it’s easier to protect you like this. You can stay here until I defeat the vampire, Tohno-kun. There’s no need for you to get involved in this battle,” Ciel said.

“It’s not like I can fight at this size, anyway. But won’t Arc come looking for me?”

“I’ve placed a barrier on this building that will conceal your presence from the princess. She can search the whole world if she wants, she’ll never find you here” she says dismissively. “I’ll tell your sister that you’ll be away for a while as well, so don’t worry about that.”

“Man, I can’t even go to school like this, either,” Shiki pouts, angrily kicking an alarm clock. “I hope Arihiko will survive without me.”

“I’ll keep an eye on him, Tohno-kun,” Ciel said with a mischievous smile. It seemed like some of her normal personality was starting to show through. Shiki blushed as his stomach growled. It was now the wee hours of the morning, and many hours since he ate Kohaku’s delicious dinner. But he was also plastered with rank, curry-stained saliva and could really use a bath.

13223.content:
(Just a word of warning. This introduction very spoilerish so if you have not read Tsukihime and care about spoilers I'd stop here.)

This house was a prison. In a bed inside the Tohno Household that was all a young man could think. Upon returning to his original home Shiki never thought he'd be thinking like that, but he was. His house was a prison. Or perhaps that was too grand, his room or even his bed could have been the prison. After all, he couldn't move. Physically there was no reason to it, but for all intents and purposes Shiki's body was paralyzed. The cause: his own sister.

It wasn't even an hour ago Shiki confronted Akiha. He'd found out she'd been sucking blood from people at night and demanded answers. What he got was something unexpected. Now with vermilion red-hair, the woman explained how she killed the original blood-sucking killer, and now she was the one sucking blood. For whatever reason Shiki had a connection to the original killer, they shared a life force so neither could truly flourish while the other lived. And now that Akiha had killed that person, she seemed to take his place. She and Shiki shared a life force, so she sucked blood each night in order to keep them both strong. Akiha revealed all of this without a care in the world. A part of Shiki wanted to kill her as she confessed, but he didn't do it. He listened, and then Akiha made the one request he couldn't fulfill. She wanted him to love her. Not as a sister, but as a woman.

It wasn't really a matter of incest, Shiki knew he was adopted, but even so he saw Akiha only as a sister. Though that wasn't the main reason. The truth was...there was another, one of the maids of the Tohno house, Kohaku. Shiki loved her. And when he told Akiha that...she did this to him.

Because they were connected, all it would take is a thought of Akiha and Shiki would die. Akiha displayed this power by taking away Shiki's ability to move. But despite that he still held loyal to Kohaku. Akiha seemed confident he would change his mind though. She called the maid to take him to his room as if it were the most trivial of matters. So here he was, trapped and unable to move at all.

Damn it...Shiki thought to himself. Even the simple ability to talk seemed to escape him right now. His body felt like someone else's, something beyond his control. He was Akiha's puppet, and he knew it. That wasn't what frustrated him though. What frustrated him was the fact he couldn't help Akiha. Whatever was causing this...change...it wasn't her. She didn't seem to realize it but something was controlling her. Even if her personality remained dominant its influences were obvious. Whatever that something was, Shiki wanted to do something about it. Though he wondered how. When he couldn't even walk without Akiha willing it so?

Sleep

Huh? All of a sudden the young man felt exhausted. His eyes grew heavy, he struggled to hold them up.

Sleep Nii-san. When you wake up...

Shiki couldn't hear anymore. He was asleep.

In the last week with each night being plagued by dreams of murder and blood-sucking, Shiki'd forgotten what a regular, dreamless sleep felt like. It was a reprieve he'd really needed. A chance for his mind to relax even if for a moment. Though like all pleasant things, it went by far too fast. Before he knew it Shiki's eyes were already fluttering awake.

"Huh? Man that was a good nap..." He scratched his head...Wait...scratched his head?

"Ah?!" The young man looked at his hand. He was moving it! His body could move! Hands, legs, arms, everything seemed to be in working order. The relief of mobility again brought a smile to Shiki's face. A smile that instantly vanished when he realized something.

"Where am I?"

He was somewhere new...Or rather...some place familiar, but nothing he could recognize. The furniture still resembled that of the Tohno Household, but it seemed so much...bigger. And that was the key word. When Shiki looked at everything he realized he did recognize this room, it was only huge! Or to be more specific, Shiki was small. Yes, with that realization the chairs now looked like chairs. The shelves resembled shelves. Even the big plain Shiki had woken up on was now very clearly a white table. Though knowing what had happened didn't diminish the shock.

"I...shrank?!" Shiki muttered in disbelief. "How?! Why?!" His mind racked the possibilities although the answer was as obvious as ever. He shrinks hours after finding out his sister had total control over him. Who else could it be?!

Click The room's door opened as a figure stepped in. Even though Shiki had seen the person plenty of times, seeing them as a towering giantess brought a look of awe upon his face. He shouldn't have been as surprised as he was, given that he was in their room. But even so, he'd woken up shrunken and now was staring at...

info.brief_description: A Size Changing Interactive based around the various series and games of Type-Moon!
info.description:
The title explains it pretty well but in case you still don't get it this here is a Size Changing Interactive built around the various works of Type-Moon!

List of works include: Fate/Stay Night, Tsukihime, Kara no Kyoukai, Fate/Zero, Melty Blood, Fate/Extra, Carnival Phantasm and more!

Before anything else let us go over the basic rules:

- Only female giants
- Both Growth and Shrinking is just fine
- Please keep characters in character (Unless it's Carnival Phantasm then go nuts.)
- No one sentence chapters if possible
- Please nothing extremely anal, toilet, anything with unbirth, or things along those lines. Just my preference.
- Unless you still don't get it this is only for things created by Type-Moon. Nothing outside of that!
-And lastly please keep it competently written!

And I want to make a special mention for Carnival Phantasm. CP is mainly parody so it has something of its own set of rules. Characters can be OOC, things do not necessarily have to make 100% sense and you can just have fun with it. Also instead of the standard "Pick Growth or Shrink then pick Character" thing. CP will have scenarios. The number of scenarios is not set so there can be as many as people are willing to make. You just set the stage with the first chapter and that's how it is. If you want something different pick a different scenario. I'm doing it like this because it'll be easy to absolutely bury it with choices otherwise. And of course it being parody, comedy is welcomed there.

Also if you pick something like the game Fate/Extra where you have a protagonist you name/create yourself...just go ahead and make it an OC. There's no point in restricting you there. Also, if someone aside from the Protagonist shrinks I'd like to keep the Protagonist female so there'd be another possible GTS to use. But everywhere else use only the characters provided!

And lastly, I know it might seem odd to have so many different media, especially considering there are certain series like Fate/Stay Night that have a bunch of different versions. But they do have differences and if anything else they can be used for different storylines if for some reason you don't like one. It might be redundant to have an interactive where you can write a different story for the manga, visual novel, anime, and animated movie but just have fun with it. That's what all this is about.

Now that the rules and extra stuff are out of the way. Please enjoy ^^
